newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama Q1 exports jump 10.1 pct $142.6 mln.
newsitem.headline: Panama Q1 exports jump 10.1 pct $142.6 mln.

text.p: Panamanian exports grew 10.1 percent to $142.6 million in the first quarter of 1997, compared to $129.6 million during the same period last year, the comptroller general's office said Friday.

"In general, the economic indicators for the first quarter period of 1997, compared with the same period 1996, present an improved performance," the comptroller general's office said in a notice published in local papers.
Bananas accounted for almost a third of total exports at $44.2 million over the first quarter, up from $43.5 million last year.

The press notice also said that permits for construction showed a strong 24.6 percent first quarter jump, with the expected value of construction rising to $96.1 million compared to $77.1 million in the same period last year.
((-- Paul de Bendern, Panama City newsroom 507 223 7739))
